So, basically this is our lecture number 13 in the previous lecture we have covered about the introduction to machine learning, we have seen about the what is machine learning, why it is useful for us and what is the difference between the traditional programming and the machine learning and we have also seen the main key ingredients of the machine learning that is data, model and learning and then we have seen also about the simple example by in which we have predicted the marks of students with the help of machine learning basically which will help us to understand what is the machine learning and how machine learning will work that all we have studied in our the previous class. Now in today's class, we will try to understand the machine learning workflow and then one to one step by step we will see the component of the machine learning workflow because we have seen that machine learning is now our integral part in a for our daily lives because in our daily lives we have we are using many multiple applications of the machine learning whether it is the whether it is in the application of recommendations, whether it is the application of Siri or Alexa. So that's why we have to understand the machine learning how what's the workflow basically how machine learning is working. So first machine learning workflow is basically it is a structured process in which we use to develop train and deploy the machine learning model. First what we do we will try to develop it then we will go for the training then we will deploy it what it ensures basically it ensures the consistency and efficiency of our systems. Now if if I will compare it with with the real world analogy like it is like when we want to cook a food first we have to decide what we have to cook for that if we have decided what we have to cook then we go for the ingredients now we will go for the it is the collection of the ingredient when then we will try to collect all the ingredient which will be which we which we will be used for that dish then we will prepare it then we will cook it then we will go for the taste. So if we will see the key stages first one is the problem identification or problem definition means in which you will decide what you have to do with the machine learning whether you have to go for the recommendations whether you have to go for the predictions or for the different types of regression and any other problems whatever first you have to identify your problems then next step is the data collection now for that problem for that problem you have to collect the data which will be useful for your problem you have to collect that types of data then you have to prepare that data because sometimes data are missing so you have to prepare or you have to prepare that data in a good form so that it is it is easily it is easy for the machine to understand that data and to catch the pattern what type of pattern that data is following.
